intro: Acronema nervosum, commonly known as the narrow-veined acronema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped with prominent, parallel veins, giving it a distinctive appearance. Acronema nervosum is often found in temperate regions of Asia, particularly in China and Japan.
